A unique and unambiguous reference to the resource within a given context.
Recommended best practice is to identify the resource by means of a string conforming to a formal identification system.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has identifier

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A news report published in a magazine issue.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: magazine news item

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A document containing notes that summarize a lecture or course of lectures.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: lecture notes

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A textual work prepared 'by hand', such as a typescript or word-processed pre-publication draft of a research paper or a report, or a work not otherwise reproduced in multiple copies. [Note: fabio:Manuscript is not intended to describe a handwritten historical document on paper or parchment, for which the FRBR distinctions between work, expression, manifestation and item (individual copy) becomes blurred.].
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: manuscript

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A rewritable data storage medium that is composed of a disk of thin, flexible (floppy) magnetic storage medium encased in a square or rectangular plastic shell. Data are encoded magnetically by a read/write head that float on a cushion of air in close proximity to the surface of the rotated disk.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: floppy disk

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A repository for storing data.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: data repository

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A non-serial document that is complete in one volume or a designated finite number of volumes. A book published by a publisher is usually identified by an International Standard Book Number (ISBN), and may be manifested as a physical printed publication on paper bound in a hard or soft cover, or in electronic format as an 'e-book'.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: book

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A correction to an error in a previously published document.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: correction

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A digital storage device built entirely from solid electronic materials with no moving parts, e.g. a USB flash drive.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: solid state memory

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The count of the number of words in a textual resource.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has word count

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A formal disclosure of a new invention approved by a governmental patent agency, made to register intellectual property rights, and to give exclusive rights to the inventor or assignee to manufacture, use, license or sell the invention for a certain number of years.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: patent

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A collection of related facts, often expressed in numerical form and encoded in a defined structure.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: dataset

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The final published expression of a work that bears the publisher's imprimatur. Typically for a journal article, the Definitive Version results from revision of an earlier submitted version of the work following peer review, and is then published in print and/or digital form after the publisher has assigned it a DOI. The Definitive Version is also known as the Version of Record, although according to the CrossRef Glossary (http://crossref.org/02publishers/glossary.html) that term can also refer to the author's final version of a work that is not formally published.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: definitive version

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The realization of a sound recording.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: audio document

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: As defined by FRBR (http://www.ifla.org/VII/s13/frbr/frbr1.htm; http://purl.org/vocab/frbr/core#realization), a property representing an expression that is an intellectual or artistic realization of a work.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has realization

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: An internal identifier for journals available from the National Library of Medicine repository.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has National Library of Medicine journal identifier

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A short rapidly published research article or conference paper, typically reporting significant research results that have been recently discovered, or a brief news item reporting such discoveries.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: rapid communication

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The physical or electronic realization of a patent.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: patent document

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment:
The file format, physical medium, or dimensions of the resource.
Examples of dimensions include size and duration. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary such as the list of Internet Media Types.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has format

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The time period for which an entity is embargoed. During this period, the entity should not be published or, in the case of a press release, should not be reported on. For open-access journal articles, the embargo duration specifies that period of time during which availability of the open-access version of the article is delayed by the publisher, following subscription-access availability of the published work. The end of the embargo period can be specified by fabio:hasEmbargoDate.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has embargo period

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A formal representation of a set of concepts within a domain of knowledge, and the logical relationships between those concepts. [Contrast fabio:Folksonomy]
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: ontology

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A description and definition of how something should be done. Ideally a policy should be both effective in achieving its goals and acceptable to those who have to abide by it.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: policy

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: This property expresses the fact that a concept is a part of a scheme.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: is in scheme

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A formal statement retracting a statement or publication A retraction is a public statement made about an earlier statement that withdraws, cancels, refutes, diametrically reverses the original statement or ceases and desists from publishing the original statement.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: retraction

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Standard bibliographic metadata describing an expression of a work. To take the example of a journal article, bibliographic metadata typically include the authors' names, the date of publication, the title of the article, the journal name and volume number, the first and last page numbers, and the Digital Object Identifier (DOI).
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: bibliographic metadata

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: As defined by FRBR (http://www.ifla.org/VII/s13/frbr/frbr1.htm; http://purl.org/vocab/frbr/core#realizationOf), a property representing the work that has been realized by an expression.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: is realization of

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: An International Standard Serial Number, ISSN, for electronic versions of serial publications.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has eISSN
has electronic International Standard Serial Number

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Metadata describing the citations made within a work to other works, and (optionally) some characteristics of the expressions of the cited works.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: citation metadata

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A collection of manifestations.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: manifestation collection

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A news report published in a journal issue.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: journal news item

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: An instructional document typically supplied with a technologically advanced consumer product, such as a car or a computer application, or with an item of complex equipment such as a microscope.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: instruction manual

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A news report published in a newspaper issue.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: newspaper news item

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A particular published volume of a periodical.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: periodical volume

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The report of a trial, for example an experimental trial or a legal trial.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: trial report

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A formal correction to an error introduced by the author into a previously published document.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: corrigendum

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment:
An entity primarily responsible for making the resource.
Examples of a Creator include a person, an organization, or a service. Typically, the name of a Creator should be used to indicate the entity.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has creator

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A database specifically designed for the storage and retrieval of Resource Description Framework (RDF) data consisting of subject-predicate-object triples. A triple store is queried using the RDF query language SPARQL.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: triplestore

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A formal speech, for example one delivered at a ceremonial occasion, or the written transcript of such a speech.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: oration

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A print object with a flexible cover, usually made of paper or paperboard.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: paperback

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A computer system in which information may be stored.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: repository

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A Web publication medium containing blog posts.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: blog

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A written review and critical analysis of the content, scope and quality of a book or other monographic work.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: book review

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A digital manifestation on the Web, such as a wiki, a web site, a web page or a blog.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: web manifestation

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: An authoritative report or guide designed to educate readers and help people make decisions, or to explain technical problems and how to solve them. White papers are typically published by governments to propose new legislation for discussion, and by commercial companies to inform readers about products or services, as aids to marketing.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: white paper

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: An alphabetically-ordered list of words and phrases ('headings') and associated pointers ('locators') to where useful material relating to that heading can be found in a document.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: index

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A property used to tag a resource with a keyword that is likely to be used in search queries.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has keyword

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A set of recommendations for the minimum reporting requirements to be employed when reporting a particular type of investigation or project, for example a randomized clinical trial. A reporting standard may involve a checklist and a flow diagram, offers a standard way for authors to prepare a complete and transparent report of their findings, and aids their critical appraisal and interpretation of their data. [See also fabio:MinimalInformationStandard.]
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: reporting standard

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A property linking a particular item to the expression it represents. This property is additional to the relationships between FRBR endeavours present in the classical FRBR data model.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: is representation of

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A device for recording information or storing data.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: storage medium

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A work to which people refer for authoritative factual information, such as a dictionary, encyclopaedia, entry, handbook or field guide, or an informative web page such as an institutional, research group or project home page.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: reference work

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: As defined by FRBR (http://www.ifla.org/VII/s13/frbr/frbr1.htm; http://purl.org/vocab/frbr/core#exemplar), a property representing an item that exemplifies a manifestation.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has exemplar

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A form of literature written by a playwright, usually consisting of scripted dialogue between characters, intended for theatrical performance rather than reading.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: play

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Permits specification of the season of the year, for example spring, summer, autumn and winter in British English.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has season

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A name given to a resource. Typically, the title will be the name by which the resource is formally known.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has title

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: An internal identifier for the abbreviation of the title of journals available from the National Library of Medicine repository.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has National Library of Medicine journal title abbreviation

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: An editorial published in an issue of a magazine.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: magazine editorial

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: An analog sound storage medium consisting of a flat disc made of moulded vinyl plastic with an inscribed, modulated spiral groove.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: vinyl disk

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment:
A scholarly work that describes applied and validated solutions such as software tools, systems or architectures that benefit from the use of the technology of a particular scholarly domain. Usually, papers of this kind should also provide convincing evidence that there is use of the proposed application or tool by the target user group, preferably outside the institution that conducted its development.
E.g. see http://iswc2018.semanticweb.org/call-for-in-use-track-papers/.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: in-use paper

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Meaning = has part. As defined by FRBR (http://www.ifla.org/VII/s13/frbr/frbr1.htm; http://purl.org/vocab/frbr/core#part), a property indicating that one entity includes another entity.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has part

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A mapping of correspondences between two vocabularies. For controlled vocabularies, such mappings may be expressed using SKOS (http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/).
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: vocabulary mapping

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: This property relates a storage medium to the fabio:Item stored upon it.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: stores

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The creative work of making an electrical or mechanical recording of sounds, such as the spoken voice, singing, instrumental music, animal vocalizations or sound effects.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: sound recording

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Identifies the page range of an entity such as a journal article.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has page range

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A version of the subtitle of an entity translated into another language, which may be specified using the object property dcterms:language.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has translated subtitle

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A thin flexible strip of plastic or other material coated with light-sensitive emulsion upon which images can be recorded, typically using a camera, usually used to record photographic images or motion pictures.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: film

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment:
A point or period of time associated with an event in the lifecycle of the resource.
Date may be used to express temporal information at any level of granularity. Recommended best practice is to use an encoding scheme, such as the W3CDTF profile of ISO 8601 [http://www.w3.org/TR/NOTE-datetime].
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has date

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: As defined by FRBR (http://www.ifla.org/VII/s13/frbr/frbr1.htm; http://purl.org/vocab/frbr/core#embodiment), a property representing a manifestation that embodies an expression.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has embodiment

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Information prepared specifically and primarily for manifestation in a web page, comprising text, images, datasets and/or other works.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: web content

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A collection of all the literary or scholastic works of a single person.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: complete works

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A version of the title of an entity translated into another language, which may be specified using the object property dcterms:language.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has translated title

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: This property is used to associate a frbr:Endeavour to a term in a particular classification system - and the term is considered one of the main topics for the endeavour in consideration.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has primary subject term

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The version of an author's original scholarly work, such as a research paper or a review, first submitted to publisher for publication. [Note: For that version resubmitted after peer-review and revision, use fabio:Postprint. For the final published version use fabio:DefinitiveVersion.]
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: preprint

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: It describes any work regarded as art in its widest sense, including works from literature and music, visual art, etc.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: artistic work

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A news item reporting the death of a person, typically accompanied by an description of that person's life and contributions to his or her profession and to society at large.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: obituary

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A set of books having certain characteristics in common that informally allow their identification together as a group - for instance, the books of the Harry Potter saga.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: book set

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A unique identifing number issued by a patent authority to identify a patent, displayed at the beginning of the patent document.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has patent number

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A work of fiction that is usually written in prose, often in narrative format. This format tends to be more focused and less elaborate than longer works of fiction such as novels.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: short story

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A thesis reporting the research undertaken during a period of graduate study leading to a doctoral degree.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: doctoral thesis

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A movie with an accompanying soundtrack, typically created by a professional film studio, designed to communicate a fictional story, record an artistic event, or impart information that is scientific or documentary in nature.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: film
